qas.question: Who did the Ming dynasty showed favors to?
What was the the third Dalai Lama allowed to do?
What title was Sonam Gyatso granted in 1587?

answers.text: the title Dorjichang or Vajradhara Dalai Lama

qas.question: In 1653 who did the Qing emperor grant a title to?
In 1713 who did the Qing emperor grant a title to?

context: Of <a0_0>the third Dalai Lama<a0_0/>, China Daily states that the "Ming dynasty showed him special favor by allowing him to <a1_0>pay tribute<a1_0/>." China Daily then says that Sonam Gyatso was granted <a2_0>the title Dorjichang or Vajradhara Dalai Lama<a2_0/> in 1587 [sic!], but China Daily does not mention who granted him the title. Without mentioning the role of the Mongols, China Daily states that it was the successive Qing dynasty which established the title of Dalai Lama and his power in Tibet: "In 1653, the Qing emperor granted an honorific title to <a3_0>the fifth Dalai Lama<a3_0/> and then did the same for <a4_0>the fifth Panchen Lama<a4_0/> in 1713, officially establishing the titles of the Dalai Lama and the Panchen Erdeni, and their political and religious status in Tibet."
